_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The Chemours El Dorado Plant has implemented Process Safety Management processes and procedures that meet the requirements of Chemours Corporate SHE Standard PSM-S21, Process Safety Management. These Chemours Corporate policies can be summarized as follows:
- All Safety and Environmental incidents are preventable
- The Goal is Zero - Zero Incidents Period
- All employees and contractors are responsible for their individual safety

The Corporate policies are embodied in the numerous Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) and Engineering Standards, which apply globally.  At the El Dorado Plant, the policies will be implemented through the Standard Operating Procedures, Process Technology Descriptions, Process Hazards Reviews, Training Procedures, Compliance Audits, Safe Work Practices, and Management of Change Procedures.  These procedures are provided in hard copy form to all employees.  Employee Involvement Policies encourage improvement ideas from all employees and provide for employee participation in all aspects of Accident Prevention Activities.  

Prevention Programs dealing with Maintenance and Contractor Safety are provided by Service Level Agreements (SLA) with the site landlord, Lanxess, and are described by their procedures.  Emergency Response is also provided via SLA and is described in the sitewide Emergency response Procedures.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION

The Chemours El Dorado Plant consists of process equipment located on 8.8 acres of land leased from Lanxess at their South Plant Site.  The Lanxess South Plant Site is a total of 430 acres located in Union County, south of the town of El Dorado, AR.  The Fluorine Chemicals operations were purchased from Lanxess in 2008.  Lanxess operated these facilities until the sale to Chemours.  Lanxess continues to operate other processes on the site which are considered to be a separate stationary Source for the purpose of 40CFR part 68.

The Chemours

El Dorado Plant consists of 3 manufacturing units used to produce fluorinated industrial gases:
- FM200 Unit
- Pharma Unit
- OPTEON 1150 Unit

These productions units use the regulated substance, Anhydrous Hydrogen Fluoride, as a raw material for chemical synthesis.  Onsite storage volume of the regulated substance is above the threshold quantities specified in 40 CFR part 68.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The Chemours El Dorado Plant has implemented Process Safety Management processes and procedures that meet the requirements of Chemours Corporate PSM Standard PSM-S21, Process Safety Management.  This Standard includes and embraces the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119 and 40 CFR Part 68.

Our Safety Programs include:

Designing for Safety:
- A documented process technology system which covers the hazards of materials, process design basis, and equipment design basis.
- Extensive accident prevention and mitigation systems.
- Applicable codes and standards which are met or exceeded.
- Materials of construction are chosen to provide mechanical integrity.
- Quality Assurance ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications and proper assembly

Maintaining our Plant:
- Maintenance personnel are trained, and experienced personnel provided by Chemours or Lanxess
- Contractors are trained and qualified by Chemours or their contracting company
- A work permit system controls hazards associated with maintenance work.

Operating Safety:
- Operators are trained and job qualified.
-Technical resources are available and utilized as required.
- Operators follow approved written procedures.

Auditing our Operations:
- Routine safety inspections are conducted.
- Corporate, independent and governmental audits and reviews are conducted.
- Process Hazards Analyses are conducted.
- Safety critical equipment is set up on periodic inspection frequency to ensure mechanical intregrity.
- Pre-startup Safety Reviews are conducted pr

ior to starting up any new or modified equipment.
- Quality assurance of critical equipment ensures fabrication in accordance with design specifications.
- All incidents are investigated, and actions taken to prevent recurrence.

SAFETY IS A JOB REQUIREMENT FOR ALL EMPLOYEES AND CONTRACTORS!

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

A release of 85.8 pounds of HF occurred July 15, 2022, at 1:04 am.  This is the only event within the past five years.  The details to this event can be found in S6. Five-Year Accident History of this RMP.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Emergency response is provided by the site Landlord, Lanxess, via a Service Level Agreement (SLA).  The Chemours El Dorado Plant units and chemicals are included in the Lanxess South Plant written emergency response plan that deals with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination.  Annual drills are conducted and critiqued to assure readiness and adequacy of the emergency response plan.  The emergency response plan is promptly updated to reflect any changes required as a result of learnings from drills or for process changes that require modified emergency response.

To ensure proper functioning, the site emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.

Union County Arkansas is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which the Lanxess South Plant site emergency response plan is coordinated.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The Chemours El Dorado Plant plans to continue efforts to improve safety through corporate audits and response plans to bring the site into better alignment with overall Chemours corporate policies and standards.
